keyMoments.title: Straw Hats Prepare to Assault Enies Lobby
keyMoments.description: As the drawbridge is lowered, Luffy declares they will save Robin and the crew prepares to assault the World Government stronghold.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the beginning of the direct assault on Enies Lobby proper by the Straw Hat Pirates.

description: A judicial island under the World Government's control, known for its massive courthouse and the Gates of Justice. The island is perpetually daylit, earning it the moniker 'The Island That Never Sleeps.'
significance: The location where the Straw Hats declare war on the World Government to rescue Nico Robin, one of the most significant events in the series.

keyMoments.title: Flashback: Luffy Destroys Nami's Cartography Room
keyMoments.description: In flashback, Luffy discovers and destroys the room where Nami was forced to draw maps for Arlong for years.
keyMoments.significance: Symbolizes Luffy freeing Nami from her painful past and the physical manifestation of her imprisonment.

keyMoments.title: Flashback: Arlong Park's Destruction
keyMoments.description: The flashback shows the collapse of Arlong Park after Luffy's final attack on Arlong, ending the Fish-Man's reign over Cocoyasi Village.
keyMoments.significance: The destruction of Arlong Park represents the liberation of Nami and her village from eight years of oppression.

description: The headquarters of the Arlong Pirates in Cocoyasi Village, built as a grand base for the Fish-Man pirates. It contained a cartography room where Nami was forced to draw maps.
significance: The site of Nami's imprisonment and eventual liberation by the Straw Hat Pirates. Its destruction symbolized freedom for Cocoyasi Village.

keyMoments.title: Flashback: Villagers March to Arlong Park
keyMoments.description: The flashback shows the desperate villagers, led by Genzo, preparing to attack Arlong Park to free Nami despite knowing they would likely die.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the depth of the villagers' love for Nami and their willingness to sacrifice themselves for her freedom.

keyMoments.title: Flashback: Nami's Breakdown in Cocoyasi Village
keyMoments.description: The iconic scene where Nami breaks down and asks Luffy to help her after years of suffering under Arlong's control.
keyMoments.significance: One of the most emotional and pivotal moments in One Piece, establishing the depth of the Straw Hats' bonds.

description: A peaceful village in the East Blue that was Nami's home. The village was oppressed by the Arlong Pirates for eight years until Luffy and his crew defeated Arlong.
significance: Nami's hometown and the location of her tragic backstory. The village's liberation was one of the early defining moments for the Straw Hat Pirates.
